Posts.Content: I had RALP on Oct 3 and I just got the catheter out and the pathology report (dated over a week ago) from my surgeon a couple of days ago Oct 18. The report says I'm stage pT3a with non-focal extraprostatic extension and margins cancer free. When I got home I found a letter from my local cancer treatment center (Canada) with an appointment for a PSA test in early December and an appointment with a radiation oncologist in mid December. I'm a little freaked out. I guess I should call and ask about the purpose of the appointment but I don't see why I would be given this appointment if I wasn't going to be offered radiation therapy. I can call the cancer clinic and ask questions but I don't even know what questions to ask. Suggestions are welcome. Thanks
Posts.Signature: July 2017 Age 57. Frequent night urination. PSA lab reading 5. DRE revealed lumps. August 2017 Biopsy reports PCa in 6/12 cores Gleason 4+3=7. Clinical stage T2b. October 3, 2017 Robotic prostatectomy. Pathology: Adenocarcinoma Prostate 53.7 g, 3.7 x 5.0 x 4.0 cm Gleason primary 4 secondary 3 tertiary 5 Grade group 3 Tumour 15% Extraprostatic extension non-focal left posterior and area surrounding left seminal vesiscle Seminal vesicle invasion not identified Margins uninvolved by invasive carcinoma Left and right pelvic lymph nodes invasion not identified Stage pT3a pN0 pMx
Posts.Title: Just got pathology pT3a and appointment with radiation oncologist

Posts.Content: Thanks all. I'm really reassured by your responses which give something concrete to undertand. Every day I'm less anxious, getting used to this next stage I guess! I will ask about uPSA.
